intro: Psychotria boraginoides, commonly known as the blue psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Psychotria boraginoides is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some cultures for various health purposes.
